name: Curried Tomato Sauce For Soft-Cooked Eggs
recipeIngredient: 1 tablespoon vegetable oil or clarified butter
1 teaspoon whole black caraway seeds or 1/2 teaspoon black mustard seeds
1 1/2-inch piece fresh, peeled ginger, grated fine
1 teaspoon seeded and minced green chili

recipeInstructions.text: Fill a medium bowl with ice water, and set aside. Mark a small X in base of each tomato with paring knife. Bring 5 cups water to boil in a medium saucepan. Add tomatoes. Blanch 10 seconds. With a slotted spoon, dunk tomatoes in ice water for 30 seconds. Peel, halve lengthwise, and seed tomatoes. Cut into 1/4-inch dice. Set aside.

Heat oil or butter in a 10-inch nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Add caraway or mustard seeds, and cook briefly until fragrant. Add shallots, and sauté until fragrant and translucent, 2 minutes. Stir in tomatoes, ginger, garlic, curry, cinnamon, brown sugar, salt and chili. Sauté until soft and fragrant, about 5 minutes. Remove from heat, and stir in butter.
Spoon tomatoes over eggs. Sprinkle eggs with cilantro, and serve at once.
